contests.name: Connected Outdoor Furniture
contests.description:
THIS CONTEST IS A SHOWCASE >>> HELP TO LEARN HOW TO USE HUBBE.RS

BELOW 7 CRITERIA DEFINE ALL REQUIREMENTS THAT A PROPOSED PRODUCT MUST REPECT TO WIN THE CONTEST. 

JURY EVALUATION OF CONTESTANT ENTRIES WILL BE BASED ON THE ADEQUATION BETWEEN PRODUCT REQUIREMENTS AND PROPOSED PRODUCT. 

1 - Product Usage description (place of use, target user/markets, Price range )

Product can be wearable or not, for men/Women/Kids. Price range is open to anything. 

2 - Expected product function (function, perf. range)

Could be any current existing function (alarms, notifications) in such products, or any new function to imagine. Connected jewel could be autonomous or not (self powered or not), paired or not (totally independant, paired with phone through a specific app, paired with another fixed or mobile device....or any other combination you may imagine)

3 - Dimensional Requirements:

No specific requirement, but ergonomy and practicality must be considered so it is convenient and pretty for target end users.

4 - Material Requirements:

Precious, Semi-precious or not precious materials can all be considered. Idem for Surface finishing.

5 - Visual Requirements: 

Nothing specific, but the product must qualified as a jewel for adult.

6 - Component/Subassembly requirements: Not limited

7 - Fabrication process requirements: Not limited

* Some Friendly recommendations:

hubbe.rs is not deciding who is winning (see Contest Policy), only the crowd decide. But, let us give you below some advices that may increase your chance to win this contest.  Contestant should resd "Tips for contestants" and Jury should also read "Tips for Jury".

 - The challenge of this contest is to propose a beautiful design with an interesting connected function.   

 - Connected Function(s) could be completely new, do not try to consider too much the technical feasibility, but do not propose obviously impossible technologies, time travel does not exist !!   

 - Entries with classic or existing connected functions also can be interesting, but they should offer some kind of innovation at least in the design, or they will have trouble competing in this challenge.
contests.market:
MARKET HINTS  ARE PROVIDED HERE BY HUBBE.RS TEAM FOR THE SOLE PURPOSE OF PROMOTING CREATIVITY WITHIN OUR CONTEST, AND ALSO TO HELP CONTESTANTS AND JURY CLARIFY INNOVATION TARGETS. 

MARKET HINTS PROVIDED HERE DO NOT CONSTITUTE A MARKET STUDY, AND ONLY REPRESENT A PERSONAL VIEW OF HUBBE.RS TEAM. 

We encourage strongly all contestants to:

- Do their own research, so they can explain and justify later on their design choices and innovation options to Judges when they submit a product proposal. 

- Define clearly in their entry which problem or issue their proposal may solve or improve. Why the world could need this new product ?

- Define if the new envisionned product would serve an existing market, or try to enter a new segment, or something else... ?


1 - List of existing products (by product type) : 

Enclosed list is non exhaustive, and only represent an overview of what could be found on the market at the time of the contest launch.  

see here (link) 

2 - Markets size range "rough" estimation (to be confirmed):   

Number of existing brands, Number of models, Total number of unit sales/year 

3 - Current typical user: 

Age range, Sex,  

4 - Current retail price range: 

Price range per product type, Market size range (kUSD/year)
contests.rules:
CONTESTANT MUST READ CAREFULLY THE "CONTEST DESCRIPTION" AND "CHALLENGE REQUIREMENTS" AND AGREE WITH IT BEFORE ENTERING A COMPETITION.

NO PURCHASE IS NECESSARY TO ENTER OR WIN. HUBBE.RS IS NOT SELLING ANYTHING TO CONTESTANTS or JURY, AND A PURCHASE OF ANY KIND DOES NOT INCREASE THE CHANCES OF WINNING.

General standard rules: Below 10 basic principles are only an overview of the contest rules summarized here for contestants and juries convenience. For full legally binding texts, please refer to documents provided  as links below.

1-  Any hubbers' registered user of 18 years of age or above can apply to become a Contestant or a Jury. hubbe.rs is the sole contest moderator, and has all rights to not accept a contestant, a jury or an entry. 

2 - Contest entries must be filled through hubbers' website www.hubbers.io by a registered User of hubbe.rs  (for more infos on entry preparation, please see “Tips for Contestant","Tips for Jury” ).

3 - Contest entry and proposed product will be evaluated independantly by Juries registered on hubbe.rs website www.hubbe.rs . All Juries must be registered used of hubbe.rs. Winners will be notified directly through the email provided during registration.

4 - Entry evaluation by each Awards Judge is based on a clear set of rules, and hubbers has no control over Awards Judge's ratings of any specific entry. Final rating and ranking of a contest entries is calculated automatically based on the rating average of all Jury for each entry(for more informations on product proposal and contest entry evaluation, please see "Innovation Contest entry evaluation method" ).

5 - Contest entries with a final rating under 8/10 will not be entitled to any prize, regardless to their final overall ranking.

6 - The number of entry per contestant is limited to one, but an entry can be amended up to 5 times. 

7 - Entries must comply with hubbers' requirements (see “Innovation contest User Manual”, "Terms of Use", "Contest policy" ) and  all related Intellectual Property Rights of the contestant's country.

8 - Contestant keep full Intellectual Property (IP) right linked to his/her entry, and according to related laws applying.

9 - By entering and winning hubbers' Innovation Contest, the Contestant agrees to grant to hubbers' a  license for a limited time to produce and sell any product resulting from entry's development on hubbe.rs' plateform. In exchange, hubbe.rs' would pay Royalties to the contestant after any sales of the product proposed in contestant's entry. (For more details on this licence agreement, see "Terms of Use" and "Contest policy") 

10 - Judges and Contestant are strongly encouraged to communicate directly as much as possible before the competition is closed, so contestant can improve his/her entry according to juries feedback.

innovation_categories.description: Put together functions that are not usually related or seen in the same object

innovation_categories.description: Any kind of new or added function related to wireless communication, wireless functions, IoT...etc

contests.name: Smart Keychain
contests.description:
Create a connected IoT keychain (plus App) that helps to monitor and track where our house keys, phone, car keys are. Hubbers welcomes designs focused on the following key areas:


  1. Technology: use of modern technology, easy to set up and connect the devices, and contains safety feature for owner’s protection.
  2. Connectivity: use of the Internet (3G, 4G, Wi-Fi) and App to allow for convenient use anywhere and anytime.
  3. Price point: functionality paired with affordability. This item is targeted to be widely available on the market and ensure people use it as much as a phone cover. (How about an idea of a sensor built in your phone cover for a start?) We welcome ideas without limitations but don’t forget to consider viability and manufacturability.


The evaluation of contests are based on how the product (or idea) delivers on the following criteria :


  • Functionality
  • Price
  • Manufacturability and scalability
  • Technology
  • Dimensional requirements
  • Materials used
  • Visual requirements and design
  • Originality (however contestants are not restricted to always invent new ideas. We welcome the improvements and adjustments of already existing products, services, and ideas)


Please remember, the winner is selected by the members of the Hubbers community from around the world and not by the Hubbers management team.

contests.name: Connected food container
contests.description:
Create a food container that can be heated or cooled through an office USB or even an App. Our target market is students, health-conscious office workers, people without access to kitchen facilities during their working hours but wants to eat a hot meal. Hubbers welcomes designs focused on the following key areas:

  1. Functionality: consider the circumstances when smart food container is used and adhere to the needs of convenience, size, and ease of use.
  2. Connectedness: easy and fun to operate, consider inbuilt scale, nutrition calculator or other useful community building options.
  3. Affordability: focus on the target market and ensure the technology and material choices reflect on those.
  4. Safety: consider a function to avoid overheating, burning when forgotten (auto-off switch).
